comments.body:
Ready for UX review.

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1918

Hi [~kgill], several issues here, spotted on chrome 49.0.2623.112 on OSX 10.11.4

* Menu item from more actions menu doesn't seem to do anything
* Menu item from table and tile view is not correct
* launching from the rightmost tile in the top row of the tile view seems to bring up two menus (see screenshot 1) and the dialog when launched from there contains wonky data (see screenshot 2)

Thanks!

- Menu item from more actions menu doesn't seem to do anything [FIXED]
- Menu item from table and tile view is not correct [FIXED]
- launching from the rightmost tile in the top row of the tile view seems to bring up two menus (see screenshot 1) and the dialog when launched from there contains wonky data (see screenshot 2) [ This is likely due to the issue tracked in https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-2570 ]

* There's something weird still happening with validation here. I opened the dialog, and the cursor is in the name field as it should be, but if I hit the close button the validation mechanism triggers and the field briefly shows invalid (since it is required) before the dialog closes. Then if I reopen the dialog the field is flagged as invalid immediately (see screenshot). Validation should not be triggered on close or cancel, since the user is exiting the dialog without wishing to make changes. 
* Menu item in table and tile is still not correct (says Create alarm like this" instead of "Create alarm like this one")
* Dialog title is not correct
* Dimension is not selected by default (user can change it but it should be selected, we can't assume the dimension is what they want to change)

If GUI-2570 is the underlying cause of the double menus and weird behavior, it's blocking this ticket and I can't pass this for UX until that's fixed, since I can't pass this with that problem intact.

[~jloza]: I fixed the menu item and dialog title text, as well as the validation issue when reopening the dialog. 

I'm confused w.r.t. the focusing on the dimension field requirement.  When the copy alarm dialog was reviewed on the alarm details page, the requirement was changed to set the alarm field to blank, meaning the alarm name field would need to be focused by default to prevent initial validation errors there.  I'd vote to stick with focusing on the alarm name field, as that's required before the dimensions are modified.

Action menu item issues with special chars (GUI-2570) fixed in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/c95898e69aeaeddad731c (part of https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1918)

[~kgill] the issue is not with the initial focus, it is where it should be. The issue is that when the close button (NOT SUBMIT, but CLOSE) is clicked, the validation triggers because focus leaves the name field, and the validation error continues to display when I relaunch the dialog. 

We should find a way to kill validation checking when the close button or a cancel link is clicked, as there's no need for it at that time since the use wants to cancel.

[~jloza]: Commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1918/commits/816c85f032843ecc11d7462bc7dea3e522ac2291 fixes the validation issue by reseting the forms validation error state to "pristine" when the modal is closed.  I don't see a validation error when reopening the dialog (tested on Chrome and Safari).  Could you confirm?
Validation error fixed, per prior comment in this ticket.

Validation clearing on close now, thanks [~kgill]!

I am still seeing some weird inconsistency with the dimension field not being populated. For some alarms, it is, for others it is not. Can you make that populate consistently please?

Screenshot attached of one of many examples where dimension field is blank on launch of dialog.

[~jloza]: The dialog displays a broken dimensions field when the dimension references a resource that is no longer available on the cloud (e.g. a terminated instance).  Looks as though there are a few alarms referencing instance i-cae82c6b, which appears to have been terminated on the latest dev cloud in the acct-00/admin one.   I'll see what I can do to gracefully handle that, similar to how it's handled on the alarm details page.

Invalid dimension handling for removed/terminated resources implemented in latest commits to GUI-2544 branch.  Resubmitting for UX review.  Note that a subsequent commit was required to avoid blanking out dimensions for alarms on the landing page that have valid resource in the dimensions... see https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/e20ee57ac04a7aaefc575d .  Please pull latest change prior to reviewing this again.

UX review passed, thanks [~kgill]! Ready for code review. 

IMPORTANT: Note that there are styling changes in GUI-2530 that should affect this page, so that may need to be merged first and pulled into this branch (I don't really know the proper order of things, just wanted to give a heads up)
[~dkavanagh]: This ticket blocks GUI-2354, so the sooner you can review/merge PR 1918 the better.
[~kgill], I'm well aware. It passed UX review today and I'm in training. I'll get to it when I can.
[~dkavanagh]: Just a heads up that PR 1918 passed Jenkins.  Thanks for asking for a retest there.

Verified I could copy alarm from the alarm landing page and that fields were properly populated.
used FF (OS X) and IE11 (win8.1)
